frame.name: Perception_body
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains words describing physical experiences that can affect virtually any part of the body. The body part affected is almost always mentioned with these words. It is typically expressed by the noun heading the external argument, and this noun is typically accompanied by a possessive determiner that refers to the possessor of the body part, as in the first example below: <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Body_part">My head</fex> <t>hurts</t>!</ex>
<ex><fex name="Experiencer">Nuadu</fex>, <t>aching</t> <fex name="Body_part">in every bone</fex>, had not made a sound.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition: <def-root>The Experiencer is the being who has a physical experience on some part of his or her body, or internally. Often information about this frame element is incorporated as a possessive determiner into the constituent expressing the Body Part, in which case it is not tagged separately (from Body Part), as shown below: My legs <t>hurt</t>! Sometimes, however, this frame element is expressed as an External Argument in its own right: <fex name="Experiencer">I</fex> <t>hurt</t> all over! Here, the phrase <ment>all over</ment> can be considered a kind of generalized Body Part expression, and the pronoun <ment>I</ment> expresses the Experiencer independently. With nouns and adjectives in this frame, the separate expression of the Experiencer is more common: <fex name="Experiencer">I</fex> have a <t>pain</t> in my leg. </def-root>

FE.name: Body_part
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is the location on the body where the physical experience takes place, typically expressed as External Argument, often as PP complement: <fex name="Body_part">My legs</fex> are a little <t>sore</t>. I'm a little <t>sore</t> <fex name="Body_part">in my legs</fex>. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> describes the cause of the perception the body is experiencing.</def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Subregion</fen> is the specific area of the <fen>Body_part</fen> which experiences the sensation. <ex><fex name="Body_part">My leg</fex> <t>aches</t> <fex name="Subregion">under the bandage</fex>. </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: burn.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: feel pain, as though through heat

lexUnit.name: hurt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a part of the body) suffer pain.

lexUnit.name: itch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: experience an unconfortable sensation that causes a desire to scratch the skin

lexUnit.name: prickle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: experience a tingling or painful sensation on the skin.

lexUnit.name: smart.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: feel a sharp, poignant pain.

lexUnit.name: sting.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: present a sharp pain, as though caused by a piercing wound

lexUnit.name: tickle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to have a sensation as though being tickled.

lexUnit.name: tingle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: experience a slight stinging sensation

lexUnit.name: goosebump.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a pimply state of the skin with the hairs erect, produced by cold or fright

lexUnit.name: pain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause mental or physical pain to.

lexUnit.name: pain.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strongly unpleasant bodily sensation such as is caused by illness or injury.

lexUnit.name: hum.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to tingle as if from a low vibration

lexUnit.name: spin.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: feel as though something were rotating on an axis

lexUnit.name: be killing.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: ((some object, usually a body part)) causes pain to

lexUnit.name: discomfort.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of physical distress

lexUnit.name: chafe.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become sore as a result of rubbing
